message.content:
cs.CR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE 

The paper discusses the use of deep learning in cybersecurity, specifically in malware detection. This suggests that the paper could belong to the cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) sub-category. The paper also proposes a new defense mechanism for deep neural networks, which falls under the cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-categories. The proposed technique involves nullifying features within samples, which is a technique commonly used in computer vision, suggesting that the paper could also belong to the cs.CV (Computer Vision) sub-category. Finally, the paper evaluates its proposed technique using datasets commonly used in image recognition research, which further supports its potential inclusion in the cs.CV and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-categories.
